intro: Uncaria africana var. myrmecophyta, commonly known as the African climbing shrub, is a species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers and red, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds and small mammals. It is also notable for its association with ants, which inhabit the hollow stems and provide protection against herbivores.
